name: weaving of synthetic fibre, for industrial use | weaving, synthetic fibre | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20903/documentation

Inventory refers to the service of weaving a synthetic fibre. The dataset can be used with nylon, polypropylene and other types of thermoplastic fibres. The service should be used along with the raw material. The material to be used with this service should be 101.5% of the final product; for instance, for 1 kg of weaved synthetic fibre, a user should use 1.015 kg of raw material, be it nylon, polypropylene or other thermoplastic. The dataset is an estimation of the respective process. Waste polypropylene is chosen here to be an approximation of the waste generated by this activity, which depends on the raw material the user will choose. If this waste fraction is deemed irrelevant by the user, a modification is recommended.

The service has no actual input of the synthetic fibre, thus it starts with other necessary input materials and services.

The inventories includes energy consumption and infrastructure requirements for the service of weaving a synthetic fibre.
category: C:Manufacturing/13:Manufacture of textiles/131:Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles/1312:Weaving of textiles

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset was constructed with expert judgement of the relevant process only covering electricity consumption and infratructure requirements.

flow.name: weaving, synthetic fibre
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/13:Manufacture of textiles/131:Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles/1312:Weaving of textiles

exchanges.description: It is consider that during the process 1.5% of the raw material is eventually not passing the quality control and hence discarted as waste polypropylene. Waste polypropylene is considered here as an approximation. The waste farction generated in this dataset depends on the input material a user will choose to couple this service with.

exchanges.description: No information was readily available about infrastructure and land-use of a relevant plants. Therefore, in this study, the infrastructure is estimated based on the module "chemical plant, organics". This module assumes a built area of about 4.2 ha, an average output of 50'000 t/a, and plant life of fifty years. For this study, the estimated value is 4.00 E-10 units per kg of produced woven synthetic fibre.
